blog.readTitle: How to read a Japanese auction sheet

guide.title: How to read a Japanese auction sheet
guide.intro: Match the numbers on the sheet with the explanations below.

1.title: Lot / auction number
1.desc: Identifier assigned to the vehicle at auction.

2.title: Technical information
2.desc: Manufacturer details: chassis code, model, engine, trim, transmission.

3.title: Overall evaluation
3.desc: Overall grade (e.g. 4.5) and interior grade (e.g. B).

4.title: Additional information
4.desc: Color, tyre type, specific version, etc.

5.title: Main info / summary
5.desc: Registration, year, mileage, fuel, gearbox, steering.

6.title: Administrative details
6.desc: Japanese year, registration type, engine number, consumption, etc.

7.title: Equipment and options
7.desc: GPS, leather seats, A/C, sunroof, PDK, Bose, etc.

10.title: Observations / inspection
10.desc: Inspector remarks: scratches, dents, wear, etc.

tips.1: Compare overall grade with the damage diagram.
tips.2: Check consistency between mileage, year and reported wear.
tips.3: Confirm key options (e.g. PDK, leather, Bose).
tips.4: Ask for detailed photos if anything is unclear.

annotations.title: Inspector annotation codes
annotations.subtitle: Simple reference to read annotations on Japanese auction sheets.

A1.desc: Light scratch, superficial (in clear coat only)

A2.desc: Medium scratch, visible to the naked eye, no rust

A3.desc: Deep scratch reaching paint or primer

U1.desc: Small dent, slightly visible, paint intact

U2.desc: Medium dent, clearly visible, paint intact or slightly marked

U3.desc: Large dent, visible from afar, often with paint chip

W2.desc: Noticeable wave, possibly poorly straightened panel

W3.desc: Deformed or poorly repaired panel, requires full straightening

Y2.desc: Medium crack, visible from a distance

items.1: Sizes are not measured to the centimeter, but visually estimated based on covered area.
items.2: Values in cm are indicative but follow the official USS training for certified inspectors.
items.3: An A2 or U2 may be acceptable on a 4.5‚Äëgraded vehicle, but not more.
items.4: An A3, U3, XX or R significantly lowers the overall grade (often 3.5 or less).
items.5: Symbols can be combined on the same panel.
items.6: W3, C3, S3, X, R or XX indicate heavy or structural repairs.

about.title: About MYG Import
about.promiseText: At MYG Import, we make Japanese cars accessible with peace of mind: rigorous selection, controlled processes, clear budget, secure delivery to Luxembourg.
about.whoText: MYG Import is a Luxembourg company exclusively specialized in importing vehicles from Japan. Passionate and demanding, we put our local network and our method at the service of your project: finding the right vehicle, at the right price, with no unpleasant surprises.
about.diff1: Total transparency: process, prices and timelines explained from the outset.
about.diff2: Serious selection: history (if available), condition ‚Äî we don't compromise.
about.diff3: Turnkey procedures: from the search to registration in Luxembourg.
about.diff4: Secure logistics: mandatory flatbed transport from the port (e.g. Zeebrugge ‚Üí Luxembourg City, typical cost ~‚Ç¨600 excl. VAT, indicative).
about.diff5: Personalized follow-up: a single point of contact, clear checkpoints.
about.eth2: Advice first (if a vehicle isn't a good idea, we'll tell you).
about.eth3: Compliance with standards (administrative, fiscal and technical).
about.cost1: MYG Import commission: depending on the mandate contract and chosen options.
about.cost2: Upfront conditions: the total vehicle price + commission must be paid within 3 to 7 days after the vehicle purchase in Japan.
about.cost3: EU internal transport: mandatory flatbed truck from the port ~‚Ç¨600 excl. VAT typically between Zeebrugge and Luxembourg City (varies by date, carrier, model...).
about.costsNote: (Taxes, sea freight, homologation and registration depend on the vehicle and will be detailed in your quote.)

costsExtra.p1: At MYG Import, transparency is part of how we work.
costsExtra.p2: In Japan, a local partner agent handles auctions and logistics. Their fees are standardized: ¬•90,000, plus 5% beyond one million yen, and are re‚Äëinvoiced at cost, with no margin and supporting documents.

cgv.title: Terms and Conditions of Sale
cgv.intro: These Terms and Conditions of Sale govern the services provided by MYG Import by Car Spark Import.
cgv.p1: Any order implies full acceptance of these terms. Prices, timelines and modalities are specified in the quote and/or mandate contract.
cgv.p2: For any questions regarding the T&Cs, please contact us at contact@myg-import.com.
